other_tests.findings: Pathological examination of a bone-biopsy specimen revealed findings consistent with severe osteomalacia.
Positive for radionuclide uptake in the right mandible, consistent with persistent or recurrent tumor.
Pathological examination showed reactive changes and a foreign-body type giant-cell reaction, with no spindle-cell proliferation.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Diminution in the quantity of the epithelial component in recurrent tumors.

other_tests.findings: Pulmonary lesion composed of fascicles of spindle cells identical to those in previous tumors.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Similar morphology to previous tumors with signs of metastasis.

other_tests.findings: Elevated levels of FGF23 at all sites tested, with no significant gradient.
